text: {{Infobox settlement | name = Zapala | native_name = | native_name_lang = es | settlement_type = City | image_skyline = Barrio_582_viviendas_en_Zapala.JPG | image_alt = | image_caption = Zapala | image_shield = | shield_alt = | nickname = | motto = | image_map = | map_alt = | map_caption = | pushpin_map = Argentina | pushpin_label_position = | pushpin_map_alt = | pushpin_map_caption = Location of Zapala in Argentina |coordinates = | coordinates_footnotes = | subdivision_type = Country | subdivision_name = | subdivision_type1 = Province | subdivision_name1 = Neuquén | subdivision_type2 = Department | subdivision_name2 = Zapala | established_title = Founded | established_date = July 12, 1913 | founder = | government_footnotes = | leader_title = Mayor | leader_name = María Soledad Martinez | unit_pref = Metric | area_footnotes = | area_total_km2 = 452| area_note = | elevation_footnotes = | elevation_m = 1,012 | population_footnotes = | population_total = 35507 | population_as_of = 2012 | population_density_km2 = auto | population_demonym = | population_note = | timezone1 = ART | utc_offset1 = -3 | timezone1_DST = | utc_offset1_DST = | postal_code_type = CPA base | postal_code = Q8340 | area_code_type = Dialing code | area_code = +54 2942 | website = Official website | footnotes = |official_name = }} Zapala is a town in the Argentinian Neuquén Province. In 2010, 32,097 people lived there. Censo 2010 - Localidades de Neuquén (PDF) Retrieved in 2015-01-31 ==Prehistory== The dinosaur, Zapalasaurus, lived there during the Early Cretaceous period == References == Category:Towns in Argentina Category:Neuquén Province
